description.hltext_display: Strafverfogung: De Maizière deutet Kompromiss bei Vorratsdaten an
description.content:
Strafverfolgung De Maizière deutet Kompromiss bei Vorratsdaten an
Kürzere Speicherdauer, beschränkte Datensätze und Zugriffsrechte: Der Bundesinnenminister zeigt sich im Streit mit der FDP um die Vorratsdatenspeicherung kompromissbereit.
© Sean Gallup/
Datenübermittlung vom Personalausweis zum Telefon (bei einem Versuch am Fraunhofer-Institut)
Seit das Bundesverfassungsgericht die Vorratsdatenspeicherung nach deutschem Muster im März für unzulässig erklärte, sucht die Regierung nach einer neuen Lösung. Besonders der für die Sicherheit im Lande zuständige Bundesinnenminister Thomas de Maizière versucht, mit der seiner liberalen Ressortkollegin vom Bundesjustizministerium, Sabine Leutheusser-Schnarrenberger, einen Kompromiss zu erzielen.
"Mir ist sehr daran gelegen, dass wir beim Thema Vorratsdatenspeicherung fast zehn Monate nach dem Urteil des Bundesverfassungsgerichts endlich zu einer Lösung kommen", sagte de Maizière der Neuen Osnabrücker Zeitung. Er sei bei der Mindestspeicherfrist für Telefon- und Internetverbindungsdaten, dem Umfang der gespeicherten Verkehrsdaten sowie möglichen Zugriffshürden für die Strafverfolger kompromissbereit, sagte er.
De Maizière hält für denkbar, die von der EU vorgeschriebene Mindestspeicherfrist von sechs Monaten für Telefon-, Handy- und Internetverkehrsdaten in Deutschland gestaffelt nach Nutzungsarten zu gestalten, wenn die EU-Kommission dem zustimme. Der Innenminister schlug zudem vor, über die Zugriffsrechte der Strafverfolger auf die Verkehrsdaten zu sprechen. Ein Abruf aller bei den Providern gespeicherter Verbindungsdaten käme nur bei schwerer Kriminalität in Betracht.
Das im Januar in Kraft getretene Gesetz zur Vorratsdatenspeicherung hatte das Bundesverfassungsgericht für unzulässig erklärt. Telekommunikationsunternehmen sollten alle Verbindungsdaten von Telefongesprächen sechs Monate lang speichern. Bei Handytelefonaten kam noch der Ort hinzu. Von Internetnutzern hielten die Anbieter Anschlusskennung, die Zugangsdaten des Computers (IP-Adresse), E-Mail-Verbindungen und Beginn und Ende der Internetnutzung fest. Das Gesetz hatte Ende 2007 die damalige Große Koalition beschlossen, um Ermittlungen gegen Terrorverdächtige und Schwerverbrecher zu erleichtern. Grundlage dafür war eine EU-Richtlinie.
Die Richter lehnten die Speicherung aber nicht generell ab, machten aber klare Vorgaben: So muss eine entsprechende Aufsicht die Sicherheit der Daten gewährleisten. Der Betroffene muss erfahren, dass seine Daten übermittelt wurden. Wichtigste Voraussetzung: Nur die einzelnen Telekommunikationsunternehmen dürfen sammeln, damit der Staat nicht selbst in Besitz eines Datenpools kommt.
Will die Regierung die Daten künftig speichern, muss sie ein neues Gesetz entwerfen. Er könne sich auch vorstellen, bei der Strafverfolgung auf die Speicherung oder den Abruf von Standortdaten zu verzichten, die beim Telefonieren mit dem Handy anfallen, sagte de Maizière. Am wichtigsten sei die Möglichkeit, auch rückwirkend an die Bestandsdaten mit den IP-Adressen und damit an die Namen der Anschlussinhaber zu gelangen. Dies sei grundrechtlich am wenigsten problematisch, sagte de Maizière. Die Speicherfristen bei den Anbietern von Internet-Flatrates variieren derzeit je nach Anbieter und liegen zwischen mehreren Stunden und Wochen.
Mehr zum Thema
Thomas de Maizière | Vorratsdatenspeicherung | Datenschutz | Bundesregierung
Der Innenminister wies erneut darauf hin, dass er den von Leutheusser-Schnarrenberger ins Spiel gebrachte Ansatz eines schnellen Einfrierens von Verbindungsdaten für keine Alternative hält. Auf dieser Basis sei kein Kompromiss denkbar. "Auf Anordnung der Strafverfolger lassen sich nur jene Daten einfrieren, die zu diesem Zeitpunkt nicht bereits gelöscht sind."
In der Regel würden Verkehrsdaten von Telefon- und Internetanbietern aber nur noch wenige Tage gespeichert, eine sogenannte Quick-Freeze-Regelung liefe also weitgehend ins Leere. Ganz plausibel ist das nicht: Da die Frist für Einsprüche gegen Rechnungen für Telefongespräche oder Internet-Einzelverbindnungen meist mehrere Wochen beträgt, dürften die Anbieter zumindest diese Verbindungsdaten so lange auf ihren Rechnern stehen lassen.
Lesen Sie hier mehr aus dem Ressort Deutschland.

description.hltext_display: 600 Guru Siap Bersaing di POR PGRI
description.content:
Sekitar 600 peserta akan memeriahkan Pekan Olahraga (POR) PGRI XI se-Kab. Bandung yang dimulai tanggal 24-29 Desember mendatang di beberapa kecamatan, di antaranya Kec. Cicalengka, Nagreg, dan Cikancung. POR PGRI ini akan mempertandingkan 5 cabang olahraga yakni tenis meja putra/putri, bulu tangkis putra/putri, bola voli putr/putri, sepak bola putra, serta catur putra/putri. Para peserta yang ikut pada POR PGRI XI yang baru akan dibuka Minggu (26/12) ini merupakan guru yang tersebar di 31 kecamatan yang ada di Kab. Bandung.
Menurut Ketua Penanggung Jawab Kontingen Kec. Soreang, Djaja Djana Perwata ketika menghubungi "GM", Selasa (21/12), Kec. Soreang akan menurunkan 57 atlet yang merupakan guru TK hingga SMA yang ada di Kec. Soreang. "Kita sudah siapkan 57 orang untuk ikut di POR PGRI ini. Mereka sudah kita persiapkan sejak beberapa bulan lalu," katanya.
Terkait target yang dibidik Kec. Soreang pada even 4 tahun sekali untuk guru ini, Djaja menjelaskan kontingennya mengincar tiga medali emas. Jumlah tersebut lebih banyak dibandingkan 4 tahun lalu yang hanya meraih satu medali emas di cabang olahraga voli putri.
"Tahun lalu kita hanya mendapat 1 medali emas. Tahun ini kita harap bisa membawa pulang 3 medali emas. Untuk voli kita bertekad untuk mempertahanakn juara, sedangkan dua cabang olahraga lainya yang diharapkan bisa menyumbang emas yakni sepakbola dan tenis meja.
Sementara itu Kepala UPTD Disdik Pasirjambu, Drs. Ayep Rukmana, S.I.P. yang juga menghubungi "GM" mengatakan, Kec. Pasirjambu yang akan mengirimkan 80 peserta siap mengincar juara umum. Pasirjambu ikut pada semua cabang olahraga yang dipertandingkan. (B.110)**

description.hltext_display: No joy for Australian rock lobster industry
description.content:
Prices for Australian rock lobsters have plummeted after China halted imports. [AAP]
The group representing southeast Australia's rock lobster industry says its members are resigned to riding out the current halt on exports to China.
Rock lobster prices plummeted after the Chinese stopped importing rock lobsters from Australia.
Australian officials on Wednesday met the group representing lobster fishers, processors and exporters from South Australia, Victoria, and Tasmania.
The industry group's Gary Morgan says the Hobart meeting heard there's still no sign of China resuming full trade.
"There's no sign, but then again there's also no indication that things are getting any worse."
"And I think that markets fluctuate, access to markets fluctuate, and I think what we're seeing is just one of those fluctuations."
"In fact I think it was mentioned today that this is something like 20-odd times that this has happened over the years."

event_or_fact.property: the Hobart meeting heard there's still no sign of China resuming full trade
And I think that markets fluctuate, access to markets fluctuate, and Ithink what we're seeing is just one of those fluctuations.

description.hltext_display: Was die Tablet-Anbieter 2011 planen: Die Gerüchte um iPad & Co.
description.content: Mit dem iPad hat Apple die Konkurrenz 2010 nahezu komplett vom Platz gefegt. Geht es nach der Konkurrenz, soll sich das 2011 ändern - aber auch Apple hat wohl eine Überraschung in der Hinterhand.

description.hltext_display: コンタクトレンズが怖い - はずしたほうがいいのでは？
description.content:
今、日本では中学生でアメリカでは高校生をしています。
さきほど親の勧めで初めてアメリカのコンタクトレンズを購入し、現在着用しています。
ですが、目がゴロゴロしてきて少し痛くなってきました。
４時間経つまで外してはだめだといって親は今でかけてしまってます。
すごくこわいです。
こういうときはまずどうすべきでしょうか？
ユーザーID：0719914979
お気に入り登録数：4
古いレス順
レス数：6本
タイトル
投稿者
経験者
2010年12月21日 13:06
ハードですか？ソフトですか？上手く外せそうですか？外すときは失くさないように注意しましょう。
初めての１日目なら１時間でもいいです。外せるのなら外していいです。２日目は２時間、３日目は３時間と徐々に時間を延ばしていけばいいです。普通は何日かで違和感が無くなってきます。
それでいつまでもゴロゴロ痛いのなら合っていない可能性がありますので、お医者さん（眼科医）に行くといいでしょう。アメリカでは直接お店で買えるのですか？日本では医師の診察が必要です。
頑張って！
ユーザーID：7727614986
くま
2010年12月21日 13:56
まばたきをして涙を出すようにしてみましょう。
それでも痛いのなら、我慢しないで外してください。
コンタクトは合わない人には合わないです。
失明の危険もあるので、自分で無理だと思ったら使ってはいけません。
ユーザーID：9137260410
マロン
2010年12月21日 14:02
コンタクト装着中もつけてよい目薬などがあったらつけてみたらいかがですか？
慣れないうちは多少のゴロゴロ感はありますが段々気にならなくなりますよ！
ユーザーID：7536262764
みっしぇる
2010年12月22日 1:44
本当はコンタクトレンズを購入した所にすぐ戻ってみてもらったほうがいいんですけどねー
まず、必ずコンタクトレンズ用の目薬を差して、外してください。でも、無理矢理剥がそうとすると目を傷つけますから、簡単に外れなかったら、再び目薬をさし、再度挑戦してください。
ゴロゴロと痛いのは、ハードなら（最初の頃は）しょうがないし、ソフトならゴミがはいったり、裏返しに入れていた時におこります。目が疲れている時にも痛くなります。
ユーザーID：4001971195
debu
2010年12月22日 1:48
インターネット検索で「日本コンタクトレンズ協会」のホームページを見つけてください。
そこに「コンタクトレンズの使用方法」を書いたページがあります。
「コンタクトレンズは間違った使い方をするとこんなことに…」の項目を、我が身に起る事と考えながら読んで理解してください。
>目がゴロゴロしてきて少し痛くなってきました
怖いと思うのは、体が危険信号を発しているのです。
使い続けてはイケない症状です。目薬で解決しません。 素人の助言は危うい。
まずは正しいメガネを作りましょう。
次に正しいコンタクトレンズを眼科専門病院で作りましょう。
ユーザーID：8207997003
ぷりも
2010年12月22日 14:45
ひよこさま
Ｏ２とソフト使用経験者です。
Ｏ２のときは、最初違和感がありました。でも、あまりごろごろしていたので眼科で診ていただいたら、角膜が傷ついていた、ということもありました（１週間使用禁止させられました）。
ごろごろして、痛みが出てきているのであれば、まずはずしたほうがいいですよ。
レンズにごみがついているのかもしれませんので、洗浄してみましょう。
もしかしたら、目にゴミやまつ毛などがないっていることもあるかもしれません、鏡でチェックしてみましょう。
乾燥のためにごろごろする場合もありますので、コンタクト用の目薬などお持ちでしたら差してみましょう！
＜基本！＞レンズに触る前には、必ず手をキレイに洗いましょうね。
あと、もし1ｄａｙものでしたら、リコールかかったものがありましたね。入れると痛みが出るとか。ロット等の確認をお勧めします。

description.hltext_display: Plan comes together for new Harvest Bible Chapel
description.content:
Special to The Olathe News
HARVEST harvest_ola_122210
HARVEST For more information about Harvest Bible Chapel, visit www.harvestkansascity.org
Susan Pfannmuller//Special to th
Pastor Jeff Terrell delivered the sermon Sunday at the new Harvest Bible Chapel in Olathe.
Story Tools
tool name
tool goes here
As Christians around the world celebrate the birth of Christ, an Olathe congregation is also celebrating a miracle all its own.
Harvest Bible Chapel – with weekly worship services, strong youth and children’s programs and six other ministries for approximately 250 people – didn’t even exist at this time last year.
Last spring, Sandy Tompkins, secretary for Berean Bible Church and Berean Christian School, was giving a tour of the school campus to Jeff and Sally Terrell, the parents of three young girls.
Jeff and Sally had grown up and attended school in the Kansas City area – she at Blue Springs and he at Tri-City Christian. The son of former Kansas City Royals baseball player Jerry Terrell, Jeff hoped to follow in his father’s footsteps.
“I thought, ‘I’ll live my dream, I’ll be a ballplayer, and then I can retire early and maybe do some things in ministry,’ ” Jeff said, “But God had other plans.”
Jeff played minor league baseball, attended the University of Missouri-Columbia and worked in the corporate world for several years, but he felt called to ministry. He attended seminary at The Master’s University in Los Angeles, under the leadership of John MacArthur.
As he neared his degree completion, Terrell heard a sermon by James MacDonald, of Chicago’s Harvest Bible Chapel and the Walk in the Word teaching ministry. Terrell liked MacDonald’s passion and his message.
Since its birth in 1988, Harvest Bible Chapel has grown to five campuses in the Chicago area, and more than 40 church plants in the United States and abroad. A few of Terrell’s friends had been accepted into Harvest’s church planting program.
“I really liked that they don’t just drop you into a community and say, ‘Plant a church,’ ” Terrell said. “There’s a method to it; they’re very intentional.”
The Terrells spent eight months in Chicago, training in the practical aspects of church planting. They wanted to return to the Kansas City area and plant a church that combines a focus on God’s word with a life that includes outreach and discipleship.
Every church plant needs a core group and, as of last April, the Terrells’ core group consisted of 12 people, including themselves. They sent out 800 letters, to names gleaned from the Walk in the Word mailing list and those who had contacted Master’s Seminary.
The couple was also investigating future schools for their three daughters, and visited Berean Christian School in Olathe. Jeff remembered Berean from his high school days, but found that it had a new facility at 159th Street and Black Bob Road, and was in the process of merging with Westminster Christian Academy to form Heritage Christian Academy.
The Terrells were impressed with the school, and Tompkins, their tour guide, was impressed with the Terrells.
“Our church was without a pastor and my husband and I had made a list of what we would like,” Tompkins said. “Visiting with Jeff that day, he seemed to fit the bill.”
Tim Tompkins phoned Jeff that night, met with him the following day and “things began to roll after that,” Sandy said.
The church and the school had doctrinal convictions very similar to those of Harvest Bible Chapel. “Tim and some of the other elders were intrigued by what Harvest is doing, intrigued by the fact that I had a background similar to what they were used to,” Terrell said. They began talking to the Harvest directors in Chicago.
“Here I was just planning to do our little church plant,” Terrell said, but again, “God had other plans.”
Things progressed, with a lot of prayer, and the Berean Bible Church leaders decided they wanted to become a Harvest church. Harvest had transitioned churches before and had a model in place. For the next couple of months, they worked through the details.
“This is really the miracle of it,” Terrell said. “The school and Harvest Bible Chapel and Berean Bible Church voted unanimously to transition. It was unanimous. That’s amazing, basically turning over the leadership completely.”
With about 50 people from the former Berean church, and the core group from the anticipated church plant, this was neither a simple church plant, nor a true transition church – Terrell called it a hybrid. They worked through the summer to solidify the combined group’s identity as a Harvest church. On Sept. 19, “launch Sunday” for Harvest Bible Chapel Kansas City, more than 330 people showed up for worship.
Terrell stands amazed as the new church takes shape, including an experienced worship pastor and many other volunteers. “You have a lot of people sacrificing for the greater good of the congregation,” Terrell said, “and God’s blessing it. That’s really what it boils down to.”
Their three main areas of focus now are worship, small groups – including outreach and discipleship, and service. They describe it in three words: worship, walk and work.
“We want to do a simple church model, that is, do a few things well,” Terrell said. “Once we can do those things, then we can start branching out.”
Harvest Bible Chapel has a weekly service at 10 a.m. “The focus of our worship is to lead our congregation in worshiping in spirit and in truth (John 4:24) through biblically-sound worship music and expository preaching,” Terrell said.
Children’s Sunday School is available for ages birth through fifth grade, and 40-50 youth meet weekly on Saturday nights.
There will be a Christmas Eve service at 4 p.m. Friday at the church. “Christ came to the earth as a baby and lived a perfect life, died on the cross and rose from the dead,” Terrell said. “That’s why we can even be a church. So this is a great time of the year for us to celebrate that.”
A Bible verse, Psalm 118:23 – “This is the Lord’s day. It’s marvelous in our eyes,” is etched in stone on the outside of the building. “That captures what’s going on here,” Terrell said.
Sandy Tompkins said she has felt both peace and excitement at the miracle that is Harvest Bible Chapel Kansas City.
“God in His divine ways orchestrated it all,” Sandy said. “My lesson learned is to always be open to God’s leading because you never know who He will bring down your path.”
HARVEST
For more information about Harvest Bible Chapel, visit www.harvestkansascity.org

event_or_fact.property: she has felt both peace and excitement at the miracle that is Harvest Bible Chapel Kansas City
?But God had other plans.? Jeff played minor league baseball, attended the University of Missouri-Columbia and worked in the corporate world for several years, but he felt called to ministry
but again, ?God had other plans.? Things progressed, with a lot of prayer, and the Berean Bible Church leaders decided they wanted to become a Harvest church

description.hltext_display: Dick Jerardi: You can't compare UConn's women's team to UCLA's men team
description.author: Dick Jerardi
description.content:
His Connecticut women's basketball team now has won 89 consecutive games. The true mark of sporting greatness is domination. Auriemma's teams are so efficient, so well-coached, so locked in that each possession is treated as gold.
I only remember talking to Geno twice, once outside the Saint Joseph's locker room at Fordham after the 2003-04 Hawks had won Game 23 on the way to 27-0. We talked about his great friend, Phil Martelli, and the St. Joe's team. Geno offered some great insights and told me some things I had not considered.
I was in a group setting talking to Auriemma in Springfield, Mass., 4 years ago, the day the coach was inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame. I found him fascinating, willing to share stories about his teams and himself, respectful of the game and his place in it.
In a politically correct era, Geno is a truth teller. I have never understood media types who criticize athletes or coaches for telling you what they think even if it's not what you think or expect. If it weren't for them, what do we have, exactly?
I think Auriemma is one of the great coaches in basketball history. I don't care that he has never coached men at the college level. Coaching is coaching.
Anybody who doesn't think he could win coaching men is clueless. In fact, he was offered a chance to coach a men's college team a few years ago. I heard that it was at a serious school, not a midmajor. Geno passed on the chance.
Somebody might think he has something to prove. I don't.
All that being said, I do not understand why people are writing and saying that UConn matched and then, last night, beat UCLA's 88-game winning streak from the 1970s.
What exactly does one have to do with the other?
I may be wrong about this, but I never hear comparisons about women and men, except in college basketball. And I am not sure why.
The ball is different. A few rules are different. The games are not the same.
Yet, when a woman scores more points than a school's all-time men's scorer, she is said by some to be her school's all-time leading scorer. Same thing with conferences. At the risk of being politically incorrect, I don't get it.
One man who has consistently said not to compare UCLA then to UConn now is Auriemma himself. I had no issue with his rant after No. 88, saying few would be paying attention if a women's record were being threatened. He was right.
Still, like the coach, I simply do not understand the comparisons. What UCLA did is legendary. What UConn is doing is legendary.
Why not just revel in both? Why the need to compare. I guess that's what we do anymore. But I just don't get it.
NOT THE COACH'S FAULT
Speaking of things I do not understand, I could not figure out why Holy Cross gave Philly guy Sean Kearney just one season as head coach. A coaching lifer who spent time at his alma mater, Cardinal O'Hara, under Bud Gardler and worked with Herb Magee at Philadelphia University, Kearney finally got his chance after serving as Mike Brey's top assistant for years at Notre Dame.
And whatever could go wrong did go wrong. Holy Cross lost eight games by three points or less and another in overtime. The Crusaders finished 9-22 and Kearney, a good man in a sometimes brutal profession, was gone.
Seriously, Holy Cross? The Patriot League? Firing coaches for not winning?
The Crusaders began this season by losing their first eight games.
Kearney is back in South Bend, considering his options. He will be back in the business sooner rather than later. Meanwhile, his is a cautionary tale. Expectations are unrealistic, even at places that have no real business taking winning and losing so seriously. "That's the cold reality of our business,'' Brey said. "I thought it was truly kind of an unfair deal, but we all know what we sign up for in this profession. He's done a good job of kind of reconnecting in the basketball world. It's been good having him around. "It's pretty ruthless that way. It's a cold reminder - the highs are amazingly high, the lows are really

location.location_name: Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame

event_or_fact.property: That's the cold reality of our business

description.hltext_display: Zuckerberg ‘interested in Chinese Internet’
description.content:
Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg - on holiday in China where his social networking site is officially blocked - met Wednesday with top executives from the country's popular web portal Sina.com.
Zuckerberg's meeting with Sina.com chief executive Charles Chao and vice president Peng Shaobin comes two days after the 26-year-old had lunch with the head of search engine giant Baidu to discuss the world's biggest web market. ?Mr Zuckerberg came to get a better understanding of Sina and China?s Weibo market,? Sina said in a statement sent to AFP. ?It?s more of a casual than a formal visit.? Sina's Weibo is a Twitter-like microblogging service. Foreign social networking sites such as Facebook and Twitter are blocked by China's government but many users on the mainland access them via virtual proxy networks.
Beijing has set up a huge online censorship system sometimes dubbed the ?Great Firewall of China? that aggressively blocks sites or snuffs out Internet content on topics considered sensitive.
Zuckerberg, clearly keen to see his company crack the Chinese market of at least 420 million Internet users, told an audience at Stanford University recently that he was ?spending a lot of time? studying Chinese. ?It's kind of a personal challenge this year, I'm taking an hour a day and I'm learning Chinese. I'm trying to understand the language, the culture, the mindset - it's just such an important part of the world,? he said. ?How can you connect the whole world if you leave out a billion-six people?? Zuckerberg, who is on holiday with his Chinese-American girlfriend, met with Baidu's chief executive Robin Li on Monday, a spokesman for the Chinese company, Kaiser Kuo, told AFP. ?It makes sense - he is interested in the Chinese Internet, he's made that very plain. Obviously this is one of the big dark spots for Facebook because it is blocked here in China,? Kuo said. ?He has had a long-standing interest in China. I'm sure he wants to get the advice of someone who knows the Internet landscape well here.? Facebook told AFP ahead of the trip that the 26-year-old - recently named Time's ?Person of the Year? - was ?not doing any press or any meetings? during his vacation in China. - Sapa-AFP

event_or_fact.property: he was ?spending a lot of time? studying Chinese.

entity.property: Weibo is a Twitter-like microblogging service

description.hltext_display: Australia names new ambassadors to Laos, Samoa
description.content:
Australia's Foreign Minister Kevin Rudd has made new diplomatic appointments to Samoa and Laos.
Stephen Henningham is Australia's new High Commissioner to Samoa.
He replaces Matt Anderson, who has served in the post since early 2007.
Lynda Worthaisong is the new Ambassador to Laos.
She replaces Michele Forster who has been in the role for the past three years.

description.hltext_display: Opposition continues unauthorized actions in Minsk
description.content:
Opposition continued unauthorized actions in Minsk on Tuesday; Kazinform refers to Itar-Tass.
Several dozens of people gathered near the city detention center where many opposition members taking part in the unrest in Minsk on December 19-20 were put. They said it was an action of solidarity.
The action was initiated by former presidential candidate of the Belarusian Popular Front Grigory Kostusev and leader of the movement For Freedom Alexander Milinkevich, who took part in the presidential election in 2006.
Milinkevich said it was necessary to provide moral and material support to families of the detainees. He also said he would ask the leaders of EU member states for expressing their solidarity with the detained opposition members.
Police told the action participants that their conduct was illegal, and Kostusev, Milinkevich and the majority of other activists left the place. The newspaper Nasha Niva said that a young opposition member was detained.

event_or_fact.property: it was necessary to provide moral and material support to families of the detainees
he would ask the leaders of EU member states for expressing their solidarity with the detained opposition members

description.hltext_display: Dua Karateka Jabar Rebut 2 Perunggu
description.content:
Dua karateka Jawa Barat, Dian Saputri dan Irfan Ramadani berhasil meraih perunggu pada Kejuaraan Dunia Karateka "Open Campiana Internazionale" di Napoli, Italia, 11-12 Desember lalu. Putri --sapaan akrab Dian Saputri-- dan Irfan merupakan dua karateka dari 6 karateka yang dikirim mewakili Indonesia di ajang tersebut.
Kedua karateka Jabar tersebut meraih perunggu di nomor kata perorangan junior. Kedua medali itulah yang berhasil dibawa para karateka ke Indonesia.
"Senang bisa meraih medali di kejuaraan dunia. Meski perunggu, itu sudah cukup membuat saya bangga. Karena lawan-lawan yang dihadapi juga berat-berat," kata Putri ditemui di Gedung Dinas Olahraga dan Pemuda Jawa Barat, Selasa (21/12).
Diungkapkan Putri, selain lawan yang tangguh-tangguh, cuaca di Napoli, Italia saat itu sangat ekstrem untuk ukuran orang Indonesia. Saat itu, cuaca sempat mencapai -1 derajat Celsius. Namun hal itu bukan kendala bagi dirinya.
Selain di nomor kata, Putri sebenarnya juga turun di kumite -48 kg junior. Namun lawan yang dihadapinya memang masih terlalu tangguh bagi dirinya. "Banyak pelajaran yang bisa diambil dari bertemu dengan karateka luar negeri. Mereka memang bagus-bagus," ujar siswi kelas 3 SMA 20 Bandung ini.
Sebelum meraih perunggu di kejuaraan ini, Putri juga telah meraih satu emas dan satu perunggu di kejuaraan di Norwegia pada 2008 dan medali perak di kejuaraan di Malaysia, Maret 2010 lalu.
Atas hasil yang diraih karateka Jabar ini, pelatih karateka Jabar, Yedih Lesmana menegaskan, hal itu menunjukkan kualitas karateka Jabar memang layak diperhitungkan di tingkat nasional. Karena dari enam karateka yang berangkat ke Napoli, Italia, hanya atlet Jabar yang bisa meraih medali.
"Putri dan Irfan sangat berpotensi untuk lebih berprestasi di tingkat nasional dan internasional. Karena saat ini, keduanya masih junior. Dan kesempatan untuk terus berprestasi masih sangat terbuka," ujarnya.
Untuk itu, Yedih berharap keduanya bisa memperoleh kesempatan bertanding lebih banyak lagi, baik di tingkat nasional maupun internasional. "Semakin banyak mengikuti kejuaraan, maka keduanya akan semakin matang. Ini perlu didukung oleh semua pihak," tukasnya. (B.98)**

description.hltext_display: Retailers check water usage
description.content:
Shoprite Checkers, Woolworths and Pick n Pay, have expressed concern over speculation that a water crisis is looming in South Africa. The three major retailers say they have put in place rigorous measures to ensure their products are safe for consumption and are free of any potential contamination from polluted water supplies.
A Shoprite spokesman said yesterday that suppliers to the group?s fresh produce procurement division, Freshmark, had to comply with a standard of certification regarding farming practices, which included regulations on irrigation water.
The spokesman said the requirements stipulated that untreated sewerage water should not be used and that all suppliers were required to test their water regularly and have the results available for an auditor?s inspection. ?The requirements around the safety of water supplies are critical requirements to be met by Freshmark?s suppliers in order to receive or retain certification. Suppliers must comply with local regulations and standards ? on drinking water,? he said. If suppliers failed to comply, they would lose their certification and would be barred from supplying Freshmark. The spokesman said the audit involved the testing of produce on a continuous basis in Freshmark?s distribution centres for microbial and chemical residue activity before fruit and vegetables were distributed to Shoprite and Checkers supermarkets.
Justin Smith, the manager of Woolworths? good business journey, said the retailer?s organic fresh produce was grown without the use of artificial chemicals such as pesticides and herbicides, and without the release of harmful chemicals into water supplies.
He said the company measured the amount of water used by suppliers and aimed to reduce water use and improve water waste management during the growing, production and manufacturing phases.
Smith said the retailer?s fresh produce farmers adhered to Globalgap farming practices.
Globalgap is a standard for safe and sustainable agriculture which sets guidelines for environmental, labour and product safety standards. ?Woolworths is also working with other conventional farmers to help them incorporate more responsible farming practices in order to establish a thriving and sustainable microbial population in the soil through the ?farming for the future? programme.? He pointed out that Woolworths had completed a water trial with 66 food suppliers, which had raised issues about run-off water from irrigation practices and waste water from farm processing.
Pick n Pay spokeswoman Tamra Veley said the company was concerned about the water issue. The group monitored all suppliers and insisted on a monthly micro report from suppliers. The micro reports were verified at independent laboratories, she added.
The chief executive of the Agricultural Business Chamber, John Purchase, said in an interview recently that contaminated water was likely to be costly for food producers, retailers and consumers.
As the economy grew, he said, the various industries released more and more dangerous chemicals into the water system. ?Costs for the food producers are increasing because of the need for more electricity and water supply.? - Ayanda Mdluli

the retailer?s fresh produce farmers adhered to Globalgap farming practices

description.hltext_display: Date set for NZ Pike River mine inquest
description.content:
The inquest will be held at Greymouth District Court, about an hour from the Pike River mine.
STORY
Australian generator pumps gas at NZ mine
Published: 18/12/2010 21:56
STORY
Pike River coal mine in receivership
Published: 13/12/2010 17:07
STORY
Union wants more for axed Pike River workers
Published: 14/12/2010 15:58
New Zealand's chief coroner says the inquest into the deaths of 29 men in the Pike River Coal mine disaster will be held next month.
The inquest will be held at Greymouth District Court - about an hour from the Pike River mine where a methane explosion trapped the men underground on November 19.
The inquest was likely to be limited to confirming the identities of the deceased and, as far as possible, establishing the cause of death and likely time frames, Judge Neil MacLean said.
"Wider issues concerning cause and possible prevention are likely to be covered by the Royal Commission of Inquiry so to avoid any prejudice and allow all other investigations to be completed, the inquest is likely to be adjourned indefinitely after the January date," Judge MacLean said.
He expected to hear the best evidence available from police and other experts.
"I want to do what I can so that the families have the information they need to help them cope with the difficult circumstances surrounding this tragedy," he said.
The inquest will allow Judge MacLean to legally register the deaths and get death certificates for the families.
Meanwhile, Pike River Coal's receivers are due to provide police with a new plan to recover the bodies of the men, among them two Australians.
Progress at the remote South Island mine has been slow - machines working to stabilise the conditions are not working as well as expected and bad weather has hampered efforts.
Receiver John Fisk said it would be up to police to make a call on whether to re-enter the volatile mine.
Closing the mine "could be the ultimate outcome" if the plan failed, Mr Fisk told Radio New Zealand.
"All we can do is really try and facilitate a process and we're putting every effort we can into doing that," he said.

description.hltext_display: 小布伤愈复出改打替补 赢火箭"首场"胜利
description.content:
千呼万唤，因伤缺阵了21场的布鲁克斯终于重新回到了火箭队中！如此振奋人心的消息稍稍将姚明再伤的愁云冲淡了一些，火箭队一周内第二次战胜了国王，比分是102比93。这场胜利不仅让火箭取得连胜，更重要的是，一度渐行渐远的季后赛，又重现曙光。
火箭终于跟上大部队
还记得赛季初那个连败多场的火箭吗？一次次最后时刻的崩溃，使得火箭一度沦落到联盟倒数的位置。只是，他们的实力明显和位置不相称。很多专家还有球迷都认为，火箭队纵然没有去争夺总冠军的实力，但就整个队伍的人员配置来说，打进季后赛问题并不大。可惜，天算不如人算，接二连三的伤病打击，使得火箭阵中无人可用，整支队伍苦苦支撑。
就在球迷们快将这支“垫底”的球队遗忘的时候，火箭队却悄然爬到了西部联盟的第十位。球员们经过阿德尔曼的悉心指导，在配合的默契程度上已非赛季之初般生疏，纵使没有姚明缺了小布，火箭也可以正常运转。上一场洛瑞轰下职业生涯最高的18次助攻，足以证明火箭是有人可用的。斯科拉在内线骁勇，巴蒂尔作为领袖常有神来之笔，这些都构成了火箭落后许多依然能够一点一点赶上的关键。
目前，火箭12胜15负，距离西部联盟排名第八第九胜率同为50%的开拓者和太阳都只有1.5个胜场，可以说火箭已经跟上了大部队。如今小布又复出，阿德尔曼在用人方面又有更多的选择，完全可以对火箭接下来的表现持乐观态度。
9分1助
小布复出从替补做起
小布不在的日子里，洛瑞承担起了组织进攻的重任，已经和球队产生良好化学反应的替补控卫上一场比赛疯狂的18次助攻表现，仿佛在告诉人们，我洛瑞也有能力将火箭全队串联得井井有条！所以本场即使小布伤愈，阿德尔曼依旧让洛瑞首发。
阿德尔曼当然也是有所考虑的，小布的复出之路也要一步一步的走，步子跨大了还不知道会出啥事儿。慢慢适应场上局势，慢慢恢复，非常重要。当第一节还剩3分多钟之时，久违的小布出场了，首节两次投篮不中问题并不大，感觉需要慢慢找。果然，第二节开始后小布用两记三分宣告了自己的回归，第三节临近结束时又贡献了一记三分。整场比赛小布出场了15分钟，交上9分1助攻的成绩单，还算不错。首发的洛瑞在自己的本职工作中表现依然出色，13分7次助攻6个篮板。
关于他俩谁将在接下来几个月内成为球队的首发控卫，阿德尔曼避而不谈。“我想这事儿必须谨慎，要确保他(小布)的感觉很好才行，”阿德尔曼说，“突然间，我们拥有了一群能打球的人，这是完全不同的。我想我将谨慎使用他，看看他这三场比赛的表现了。” 张晨?
凯尔特人豪取13连胜谁敢轻言绿衫军老迈？
本报讯 昔日三巨头再加大鲨鱼，人们对于凯尔特人现今的印象颇有“明日黄花”之感，然而绿衫军昨天以99：88击败步行者之后，连胜场次竟然达到了13场！有着“新三巨头”的热火在凯尔特人面前，也相形见绌，不仅仅是因为热火目前是12连胜，比绿衫军少一场；更重要的是，热火在联盟的排名也屈居凯尔特人之后排第二，相差2.5个胜场。
本场比赛，沙奎尔・奥尼尔缺阵四场后复出，得了11分5个篮板。保罗・皮尔斯打出三双，贡献18分、12次助攻和10个篮板，他还抢断4次。雷・阿伦17分、6次助攻和6个篮板，内特・罗宾逊顶替拉简・隆多首发，得了18分，凯文・加内特9分9个篮板。替补出场的格伦・戴维斯18分6个篮板。全队表现非常平均，比赛过程一度很胶着，但关键时刻都是皮尔斯挺身而出，帮助凯尔特人稳住阵脚，最终战胜对手。可以说，宝刀未老的皮尔斯是绿衫军获胜的最大功臣。
另外一场比赛，湖人在客场以120：110击败猛龙，取得五连胜。科比・布莱恩特拿下20分，保罗・加索尔19分8个篮板，拉玛尔・奥多姆11分7个篮板。

description.hltext_display: Europa abre sin fuerza después de ver ayer nuevos máximos en EEUU
description.content:
MADRID, 22 DIC (Estutgart: 864407 - noticias) . (Bolsamania.com/BMS) .- Apertura plana en Europa después de que ayer los índices subieran en el Viejo Continente un 1% de media mientras que el Ibex sumó un 2% arriba. En cuanto a Wall Street, los principales selectivos (Dow Jones (noticias) , S&P y Nasdaq (NASDAQ: noticias) ) marcaron máximos anuales en precios de cierre, aunque el volumen de negocio, como corresponde a estas fechas, fue reducido.
Así pues, los índices al otro lado del Atlántico recuperaron niveles previos a la quiebra de Lehman Brothers, que se produjo el 15 de septiembre de 2008. El S&P cerró en los 1.254 puntos y el Dow Jones en los 11.533.
Desde el punto de vista técnico, dicen nuestros analistas de Web Financial, que el S&P, una vez superada la resistencia horizontal de los 1.227 puntos, ya no presenta ninguna resistencia en su camino hasta los 1.313 puntos.
Y, en lo que respecta a las opiniones de otros expertos, ayer Jim O´Neill, presidente de Goldman Sachs Asset Management, declaró que el año que viene será “el de Estados Unidos”. Esto es algo similar a lo que vienen señalando los analistas sobre Europa, ya que también anticipan que 2011 será un buen año para la renta variable en el Viejo Continente. Volviendo a O’Neill, prevé que la renta variable americana suba nada menos que un 20% el próximo año.
En cuanto a los mercados asiáticos, el Nikkei (noticias) ha cerrado esta madrugada con una ligera caída del 0,23%, hasta los 10.346,48 puntos.
CLAVES DEL DÍA
Estas son las citas más importantes de la jornada de hoy miércoles:
- Grecia: El Parlamento vota los Presupuestos para 2011.
- Reino Unido: Actas de la reunión del BoE, balanza por cuenta corriente del tercer trimestre y PIB del tercer trimestre (todos a las 10:30 horas).
- Estados Unidos: Solicitudes de hipoteca MBA (13:00 horas). Consumo (CONSUMO.SN - noticias) personal del tercer trimestre, índice de precios del PIB del tercer trimestre, y PIB trimestral del tercer trimestre (todos a las 14:30 horas). Ventas (NYSE: VTR - noticias) de viviendas de segunda mano de noviembre, e índice de precios de viviendas de octubre (todos a las 16:00 horas). Inventarios semanales de crudos y destilados (16:30 horas).
En el ámbito de empresas varias empresas españolas reparten dividendos a sus accionistas. Iberdrola (IBE-U.TI - noticias) entregará 0,15 euros por acción, Log (Xetra: A0B9YJ - noticias) . Hidrocarburos 1,77 euros por acción, Viscofán 0,30 euros por acción, CLH 1,77 euros por acción y, finalmente, BME (Estutgart: A0H1NA - noticias) 0,60 euros por acción. ACS (Xetra: A0CBA2 - noticias) informará sobre el número de accionistas de Hochtief (HOTF.EX - noticias) que han aceptado su oferta.
Además, no debemos olvidarnos de que, en nuestro país, se celebra el sorteo de la Lotería Nacional (esa que ahora quiere medio-privatizar el Gobierno). Suerte para todos.
ASPECTO TÉCNICO DEL IBEX
Después de ver cómo subía ayer con mucha más fuerza que cualquiera de sus homólogos, el Ibex se quedó a las puertas de la importante resistencia de los 10.230 puntos. Confirmar hoy por encima de este nivel nos llevaría de forma rápida hacia la resistencia de los 10.400 puntos.
EMPRESAS
Repsol: Jefferies & Co. inicia cobertura en comprar con un precio objetivo de 25 euros.
BBVA (Madrid: BBVA.MC - noticias) abonará un dividendo de 0,09 euros por acción el próximo 10 de enero.
Abertis planea vender su participación en Brisa (BRQF.EX - noticias) y Atlantia (Milan: ATL.MI - noticias) .
OTROS MERCADOS
El EUR/USD cotiza en estos momentos en los 1,3133.
El GBP/USD cotiza en estos momentos en los 1,5488.
El USD/JPY cotiza en los 83,72.
Futuro onza de oro cotiza en los $1389,70 (+0,06%).
Futuro petróleo (Nymex): $89,97 (+0,17%).
El índice VIX de volatilidad cotiza en los 16,49 puntos (+0,48%).
El Ibex35 acumula en el año un retroceso del 14,54%.

description.hltext_display: NHL's Winter wonderland
description.author: Brian McNally
description.content:
Brian McNally The hype is building now for the NHL's Winter Classic as Sidney Crosby and Alex Ovechkin 's teams -- the Capitals and the Pittsburgh Penguins -- reprise their classic seven-game second-round Stanley Cup playoff series from 2009. It is a game league officials and NBC television executives hope can capture the imagination of the casual sports fan much like last February's Winter Olympics hockey tournament.
With college football spreading its bigger bowl games throughout the first week of January, now it seems that New Year's Day sports programming is more competitive than ever.
"There is a particularly strong bowl lineup this New Year's Day," said NBC broadcaster Bob Costas , who will host his network's coverage of the Winter Classic. "But it will never be what it once was in terms of college football because all the consequential bowls used to be played [Jan. 1] and they all had greater cache than they do now."
Call it a pair of two teams headed in the opposite direction. The Caps went on a losing bender they hadn't endured in almost four years earlier this month and are still struggling to dig themselves out. Meanwhile, the Penguins have posted a 16-3-1 record since Nov. 6 -- and HBO's cameras have caught all the highs and lows for its "24/7" program.
That show can only help bring in viewers who otherwise don't follow the NHL on a day-to-day basis. But with four hours of back story on the players and coaches -- thanks to HBO and the festive atmosphere surrounding an outdoor game -- the opportunity is there. And really, that is the league's biggest incentive to host the Winter Classic.
"Any time you can take a great hockey fan or a casual fan inside or behind the scenes of a sports team I think it opens up some eyes," NBC hockey analyst Ed Olczyk said. "You sees these players in a different light. I think you see their personalities and their colors come out ... I don't think there's any doubt that you can really grab people when you take them inside like HBO has done."
bmcnally@washingtonexaminer.com

description.hltext_display: Moscow unveils monument destroyed by Georgia's Saakashvili
description.content:
Moscow hosted the opening ceremony of the monument "In the fight against fascism, we were together." This event will be a response to the barbaric destruction of the Monument to the Glory of the Soldiers of the Great Patriotic War, demolished at the direction of Mikhail Saakashvili in Georgia a year ago. Meanwhile, Estonia is considering demolishing of another Soviet-era memorial.
The participants of the ceremony at Poklonnaya Hill in Moscow included Vladimir Putin, the mayor of Moscow Sergei Sobyanin, as well as two prominent Georgian opposition activists, former parliament speaker Nino Burjanadze, and former Prime Minister Zurab Nogaideli. The sculptural composition was erected in memory of the soldiers and officers of all nationalities of the USSR who together defended their homeland from the Nazis.
The Press Service of the Russian Government mentioned that the idea of the monument emerged after the events of December 19, 2009 in Kutaisi. Then, at the direction of Saakashvili, the monument erected by the sculptor Merab Berdzenishvili in honor of the 300,000 Georgians who died in the Great Patriotic War was blown up. During the demolition of the monument two people were killed and several injured.
This action caused a wide resonance in Georgia and beyond. Domestically, the opposition has held several protests against this method of "rewriting the history." On its part, the Russian Foreign Ministry called the actions of Saakashvili and his entourage an act of state vandalism and sacrilege.
Meanwhile, in another former Soviet republic, Estonia, another "Bronze Soldier" may disappear. A member the unit of the ruling coalition of the nationalist party the Homeland Union and the Republic Jaan Roosnurm demanded to remove the monument to the heroes of the Great Patriotic War from the center of the spa town of Pärnu. The monument has an engraving: "Honor and glory to the fallen for the freedom of working people."
Since the monument was erected not only in the memory of those fallen on the battlefields of the Great Patriotic War, but also in honor of the fighters for the establishment of Soviet power in Estonia, Roosnurm called it "red" and proposed to move the monument to a museum. So far there was no official reaction of Pärnu mayor's office to this proposal. However, the situation is alarming as the campaign to demolish the "Bronze Soldier" in Tallinn had nearly the same start.
How should Russia resist the attempts of Georgia and Estonia to rewrite the history? How long will the two former and seemingly different ex-Soviet republics will base their policy on the Russo-phobia? Sergey Markov, the State Duma deputy, a member of the anti-falsification of history unit under the Russian President shared his thoughts in an interview with Pravda.ru.
"Is today's erection of the monument in Moscow a good step?"
"This step is completely justified. It seems that after that it would be nice to put a copy of the Bronze Soldier in front of the Estonian embassy in Moscow."
"What are the objectives of Georgia and Estonia when they are destroying monuments to the heroes of the Great Patriotic War?"
"The motives of both countries are based on the current political state of affairs. For the existing Georgian leadership it is very important to show that Russia has never been a friend of their country. Unfortunately, today in Russia there are publications representing Georgia as practically an enemy of Russia. With regard to Estonia, fighting with monuments is the continuation of its policy that has nothing to do with democracy and is aimed at alienating the Russian-speaking population from the country's public life.
"How long will Georgia and Estonia fight with the monuments and history?"
"It seems that it will be long-lasting. Strictly speaking, there is nothing surprising in this. History has always been a political tool everywhere. And if this is an anti-Russian policy, then the interpretation of history will be similar. When we celebrate victory on May 9 and actively teach history of the Great Patriotic War in schools it is also an instrument of politics. Only in this case - our own.
The talks about leaving the history to historians are not quite fair. Yes, of course, there is a part of history that should be dealt with by professionals, and amateurs have no place in it. However, there is history for the entire society, the history as the basis of remembrance for every citizen. And this is not for professionals only.
"How should Russia confront a similar policy of Georgia and Estonia?"
"Erection of monuments is a good thing, but it is not enough. The task of our politicians and our historians is to show the true history of the Russian-Georgian relations, which had at least as many good moments as it had bad ones. It is very important to invest money in history. Today, little Georgia spends more on historical research than huge Russia does. If we are careless about this subject, we will lose in the struggle for history, for the minds of people.
As for Estonia, it is necessary to use political instruments. We need to reveal the facts that prove that this country glorifies the Nazism. We need to work with the European Union, with the European Left. Let the German Social-Democrats who have anti-fascist attitude arrange obstruction for Estonians.
Today's Russia is exactly in line with the European approach to history. It lies in the fact that the past should not divide, but unite. But EU member Estonia and Georgia that is striving for membership behave exactly the opposite way.
"It looks like skimping on the history can cost us dearly?"
"Today, wars are fought with different means. If in the 20th century, the main weapons were tanks, planes and ships, today it is funds and grants. We need to give undergraduate and graduate students grants for historical research. We need to engage in publishing activities. We need to publish scientific and popular history magazines, organize conferences, and shoot films.
The United States is well aware what history means. The country does not spare expense on book publishing and movies. Today, our students often learn the history from American movies. For Ukraine, their Diaspora in the U.S. and Canada wrote their own history books with anti-Russian overtones. We can fight with them only by creating our own books, our own movies. Finally, we need to create an Institute of Russia and Ukraine that could weaken the effect of the activities of American foundations. We cannot be skimping on our history.
Russia should not silently endure abuse, no matter where it comes from. Demonstrating that we are not going to tolerate Russophobe tricks of our neighbors, we will win more respect in the world and send the right signals to our allies.

description.hltext_display: Rapper confesses to 1993 murder
description.author: Jennifer Peltz
description.content:
New York - The 1993 killing of a man outside a housing complex was a cold case for years until a suspect appeared on detectives' doorstep last week.
Apparently haunted by his secret, once-promising rapper G Dep walked into a police station to confess to the shooting, authorities said. The rapper is being held without bail after surprised investigators matched the details he provided to the unsolved slaying of John Henkel. Initially charged with murder, he was indicted on Tuesday on a charge that won't be disclosed until a court date in January.
For the 36-year-old G Dep, the case marks a nadir in his long fall from rapper on the rise. After scoring a couple of hits in the early 2000?s, he has been mired in drug and legal problems in recent years, though he was attempting a comeback with an album released online in 2010.
But his lawyer said on Tuesday the shooting case also represented his determination to turn a troubled life around. ?He's trying to remake his life,? attorney Michael Alperstein said. Guided by a substance-treatment programme, ?he was making amends.? The bearded rapper said nothing during a brief appearance on Tuesday in a Manhattan court, looking back at about a dozen relatives and supporters as he was led away. They declined to comment afterward.
Henkel was shot in the chest three times outside an East Harlem apartment complex early on October 19, 1993, well before G Dep's brief heyday. The rapper told a detective last week he pulled a .40-calibre handgun to rob the victim and fired when he resisted.
At the time of the shooting, ?I didn't think about it? - or even realise the man had died until investigators told him so last week, the rapper said in a jail interview published on Sunday.
But, he said, the shooting ate away at him over the years. ?I started to wonder if all the bad things that happened to me in my life were karma for what I did. You start to think, 'My happiness is because of someone else's sadness,? ? he said. ?I thought that if I turned myself in, it might give me closure.? G Dep, born Trevell Coleman, was one of the rising stars of hip-hop impresario Sean ?Diddy? Combs' Bad Boy Records label in the late 1990?s and early 2000?s. G Dep had hits with ?Special Delivery? and ?Let's Get It?, the second of which featured Diddy and Black Rob. G Dep's videos helped popularise a loose-limbed dance called the Harlem shake, which made the rounds among clubgoers in the early 2000?s. But the Harlem-based rapper's career slumped after his 2001 debut album, ?Child of the Ghetto?. He ran through his money and got entangled with drugs, he said in 2007, fresh from three weeks in jail after an arrest on charges stemming from a dispute with a cellphone salesman.
It was one of at least a dozen arrests on drug, disorderly conduct and other charges since the 1990?s. Records show he pleaded guilty to trespassing as recently as November 2010 and was sentenced to 20 days in jail.
Still, G Dep has been trying to revive his career. He digitally released a new album, ?Ghetto Legend?, in 2010 with a new label, Famous Records. Based in Florida, it focuses on releasing music online.
CEO Jeffrey Collins said the rapper never mentioned the shooting but was frank about his other problems when they began working together about six months ago. ?He told me he was now clean,? Collins said. ?He wants a clean start.? - Sapa-AP

the rapper never mentioned the shooting but was frank about his other problems when they began working together about six months ago
in 2007, fresh from three weeks in jail after an arrest on charges stemming from a dispute with a cellphone salesman

description.hltext_display: Tim Drumband SDN Cisitu Sabet Gelar di Malaysia
description.content:
Selain Johan Yoga Utama yang proses perekrutannya tengah dijajaki dengan manajemen tim dan pelatih Persib senior, Persib U-21 juga berpeluang mendapatkan seorang striker jebolan SAD Indonesia yang sudah dua tahun berlatih di Uruguay. Pemain bernama Sahlan Sodiq itu sudah tampak berlatih dengan Rudi Geofani dan kawan-kawan pada sesi latihan sore di Stadion Persib, Jln. A. Yani Bandung, Selasa (21/12).

Manajer Persib Bandung, H. Umuh Muchtar mengisyaratkan kesepakatannya untuk menjajaki kemungkinan perekrutan Johan Yoga Utama melalui Persib U-21. Pasalnya, proses pendaftaran pemain di Liga Super Indonesia (LSI) U-21 masih akan dibuka hingga akhir Januari mendatang.

Pemain Malaysia mengusung misi balas dendam saat menghadapi Indonesia dalam dua pertandingan final AFF Suzuki Cup 2010 di Stadion Bukit Jalil, Kuala Lumpur, Minggu (26/12) dan Rabu (29/12) di Stadion Utama Gelora Bung Karno.

Laga pertama final Piala AFF Suzuki antara Malaysia kontra Indonesia akan digelar di Bukit Jalil, Malaysia, Minggu (26/12) malam. Timnas kesebelasan Indonesia tidak mengkhawatirkan tekanan penonton di negeri jiran.
Rabu, 22 Desember 2010
Polisi Diraja Jamin Keamanan Suporter
Penuh gengsi, tensi tinggi, dan atmosfer yang panas akan mewarnai pertandingan final AFF Cup 2010, antara Malaysia melawan Indonesia. Semua pihak berharap laga ini bisa berjalan sportif dan murni olahraga tanpa ada unsur politik kedua negara yang kerap bersinggungan.

LOC Siapkan 5 Lokasi Penjualan Tiket
Panitia Piala AFF sudah merilis jadwal penjualan tiket laga kedua final di Stadion Gelora Bung Karno. Tiket akan dijual secara menyebar mulai tanggal 23-27 Desember 2010 di lima titik yang ditentukan.

Rahma Azhari dan McMenemy Berfoto Mesra

Taekwondo Piala Wali Kota 2010
Banjarsari Boyong 2 Emas
Unit Banjarsari Banzai berhasil memboyong dua medali emas pada Kejuaraan Taekwondo Wali Kota Cup 2010 di GOR Bandung, Selasa (21/12). Kedua medali tersebut diraih melalui Jati Attalah dan Arjun Fariz.
Rabu, 22 Desember 2010 Di saat bangsa Indonesia tengah dilanda euforia pada timnas sepak bola, tim drumband junior Sankdatu Junior Corps SDN Cisitu Bandung meraih prestasi internasional di Malaysia. Tim drumband junior ini mampu meraih special award pada Kualalumpur Marching Band World Competition di Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 11-18 Desember lalu.
Rabu, 22 Desember 2010
Dua Karateka Jabar Rebut 2 Perunggu
Dua karateka Jawa Barat, Dian Saputri dan Irfan Ramadani berhasil meraih perunggu pada Kejuaraan Dunia Karateka "Open Campiana Internazionale" di Napoli, Italia, 11-12 Desember lalu. Putri --sapaan akrab Dian Saputri-- dan Irfan merupakan dua karateka dari 6 karateka yang dikirim mewakili Indonesia di ajang tersebut.
Rabu, 22 Desember 2010
Akan Dibuka Bupati Bandung
600 Guru Siap Bersaing di POR PGRI
BLK. FACTORY,(GM).-
Sekitar 600 peserta akan memeriahkan Pekan Olahraga (POR) PGRI XI se-Kab. Bandung yang dimulai tanggal 24-29 Desember mendatang di beberapa kecamatan, di antaranya Kec. Cicalengka, Nagreg, dan Cikancung. POR PGRI ini akan mempertandingkan 5 cabang olahraga yakni tenis meja putra/putri, bulu tangkis putra/putri, bola voli putr/putri, sepak bola putra, serta catur putra/putri. Para peserta yang ikut pada POR PGRI XI yang baru akan dibuka Minggu (26/12) ini merupakan guru yang tersebar di 31 kecamatan yang ada di Kab. Bandung.

description.hltext_display: ProManage Names New Chief Investment Officer - Patrick Bourbon, CFA
description.content:
w Chief Investment Officer - Patrick Bourbon, CFA
From Our Money Partners
Information contained on this page is provided by companies via press release distributed through PR Newswire, an independent third-party content provider. PR Newswire, WorldNow and this Station make no warranties or representations in connection therewith.
SOURCE ProManage, LLC
CHICAGO, Dec. 21, 2010 /PRNewswire/ -- Carl Londe, CEO and Tony Sabos, President of ProManage, LLC, are pleased to announce Patrick Bourbon, CFA, has been promoted to Chief Investment Officer. Founded in 1998, ProManage provides customized managed accounts, participant advice, plan metrics, and consulting services to defined contribution plan sponsors.
Carl and Tony note:
"Patrick has proven himself to be worthy of the CIO position. He has brought a whole new level of discipline and sophistication to our investment function. We are particularly pleased with his ability to leverage resources outside of ProManage, including his consultant and academic network of contacts, to help us service our clients."
Patrick Bourbon, CFA, Chief Investment Officer
Patrick joined ProManage with almost a decade as a portfolio manager and analyst at UBS Global Asset Management/Brinson Partners specializing in equity markets. At UBS, he co-managed and optimized two global technology funds, and co-created the new quantitative trading strategy. He also conducted fundamental research and financial due diligence on global technology companies.
Bourbon earned his CFA designation in 2003. He received his Masters in Finance from the Illinois Institute of Technology in Chicago and his Masters in Engineering at EPF Ecole d'Ingenieurs in Paris.
©2010 PR Newswire. All Rights Reserved.

description.hltext_display: アメリカで家を買うには？ - １０年前に購入しました
description.content:
アメリカ中西部在住です。現在のアパートをレントして４年が経ちました。アパートが狭いので、引越しを考えていたところ、家を購入するという案も出てきました。来年早々にアメリカ市民と結婚予定です。２人ともここが出身地ではないのですが、最低でもあと５年はいたいと思っています。彼のクレジットは全くダメです。私はそこそこいいらしいのですが、今までローンを組んだこともなければ、クレジットカードを持ち始めてからも数年程度です。
家の購入といっても、２人とも貯金はゼロなので、２ベッド程度でぼろい家foreclosureでもいいので安いものを買うつもりで前向きに考えています。が、私は家の購入はおろか、ローンの組み方など全くの無知です。もちろんこれから自分で調べていくつもりですが、アメリカで住宅購入の経験がある方や詳しい方、教えていただけないでしょうか？
まずどこに相談に行くべきでしょうか？銀行？不動産？例えば収入が月＄３０００の場合、毎月のローンの支払いはどのくらいに抑えるべきでしょうか？そのほかに毎月かかる費用（税金、保険などでしょうか）やクロージングのときにかかる費用など参考になることがありましたら何でもかまわないので教えてください。どうぞよろしくお願いいたします。
ユーザーID：0741858777
お気に入り登録数：0
古いレス順
レス数：10本
タイトル
投稿者
在米者
2010年12月22日 10:31
HGTV (Home and Garden TV)というケーブル局で放送されている
House Hunter
Property Virgin
My First Place
などを見られることをオススメします。
あと、コミュニティスクールなどで不動産購入の基本を教えてくれる講座があることもあります。
アメリカで普通に家を買う時には会社を通すというより、個人のrealtorが相手になりますから、知人などを通じて信用できる人を紹介してもらって相談すると良いと思います。
ただし、随分いい加減な人もいますのでその点はよく注意して下さい。
ユーザーID：4375035668
平民
2010年12月22日 10:51
先ずは信用できそうな不動産屋のエージェントに相談されてはどうですか。日本語の方がよければ、日本人のエージェントもアメリカ中にいる筈です。
そのエージェントが不動産購入の流れなどを教えてくれる筈です。また大抵のエージェントはモゲージ会社なども紹介してくれるので、そこであなたがどの程度の価格の家を購入できるとか、どの程度のローンが組めるとかを教えてくれます。
今はローンの審査がかなり厳しいので、貯金／頭金がゼロというのは難しいかもしれませんね。でも今は不動産の買い時ですし、聞くだけなら無料ですからね。頑張ってください。
ユーザーID：7319505517
yai
2010年12月22日 11:06
基本的に４年お住みに成っていて、貯金ゼロとはどんな御事情があるのですか、お家よりは貯金をする習慣をつける事が先ではないでしょうか、お相手の方もクレジットが駄目とのこと、楽天的な人が多いと云うアメリカでもお家を考えるには、飛躍しすぎていませんか、
もっともアメリカ人はそれが普通かもしれません、でも御病気でもされたら大丈夫ですか、年金や医療保険には加入されていますか、まったくの老婆心ですが、
ユーザーID：1109698829
junko
2010年12月22日 11:07
簡単な説明がこちらにありますので参考までに。。。
収入の３分の一が一般的な住宅ローンの支払額ということらしいですね。
当方、シアトル在住ですが保険や税金は購入する家の資産価値、場所によって様々かと思います。口座を持っている銀行で相談されることをお勧めします。
ユーザーID：3689546820
唄お
2010年12月22日 11:16
クレジットがダメダメな人と結婚して家まで買うなんてチャレンジャーですね。
頭金が多ければ多いほど借りる金額が減るから払う利子分も減ります。頭金が払えないとなるとその分余計に保険をかけなければいけないんじゃなかったっけ。。借りられればだけど。今お金無ければ結局たくさん支払わなければいけなくなりますよ。
銀行でもローンのこと教えてくれます。また家を買いたいと言えば不動産屋さんも教えてくれると思います。あと、本もいろいろ出てますよ。
ぼろい家でも良いとおっしゃいますが、ぼろい家だと今度引っ越す時に売れないと思いますよ。売りに出す時にも家の見栄えを良くする為などお金入り用になります。
これからお金で苦労する人生を歩みそうなトピ主さん。心配になっちゃいますが、彼と結婚して彼の為に家を買って、それで大丈夫なんですよね？
ユーザーID：7679828052
ファタモガーナ
2010年12月22日 12:17
初めて家を購入する人向けの本が出ているのでそれで概要を学びましょう。それから、自分たちの収入ではどの程度の家が買えるのか考えてみましょう。頭金は基本的に家の値段の２０パーセントは用意しておいた方がいいでしょうが、１０パーセントでもお金は借りられます。ただし毎月いくらかの保険料を支払うか頭金をセカンドモーゲッジとして借りる様に勧められるでしょう。とりあえず頭金の貯金から始めなくてはいけないようですね。それからブローカーにコンタクトした方がいいと思います。
彼のクレジットスコアが全くだめというのが気に掛かりますね。今からでもスコアを改善する様に努力しましょう。
それから、家を見るときに買う事ばかりを考えるのではなく売るときの事も考えておいた方がいいと思います。いざ家を売るとなって、この家で買い手が付くかどうかという事も考えておかないと失敗するかもしれません。
思いついたのはこのくらいです。参考になれば幸いです。
ユーザーID：7145148175
サブプライム
2010年12月22日 12:20
確かに今は住宅価格は底値だし、住宅ローンの金利は史上最低、住宅は買い時だと思います。
「このまま家賃を無駄に払い続けるなら買ったほうが・・・」と思うのも解ります。
しかしこちらを読んでください。
低金利といえども頭金なしだと金利５％程度。
貯金がないと、家や車にかかるコストを用立てるためにエクイティローンを借りたりして
借金が膨らむ危険もあります。
家は想像以上に維持にとてもお金がかかります。
それでもどうしても欲しければ・・
月収３０００ドルだと、月の支払いはローン＋ＴＡＸ＋保険で８００ドルくらいが限界だと思います。
欲しい家が決まったら、モーゲージブローカーか、銀行にローンの相談に行きましょう。
子供ができたりして生活スタイルも変わるかもしれないし（子供を授かったり）
数年後には２ＢＥＤの家は小さいと感じるかもしれません。
そのとき家が売れずにずっとその家に縛られる可能性がありますよ。
よ〜く考えてください！
ユーザーID：7483962300
ちなみ
2010年12月22日 12:55
住宅バブル崩壊を被った人たちの失敗、これだけ報道もされてますし
もちろん見聞きされてますよね？
クレジットがダメ、頭金なし、貯金もなし。
そもそも昨今の状況だとまともなモーゲージの審査通るのかという状況です。
しかも仮に買えたとしても、今の場所に何年いるのかもはっきりしない。
ロケーションにもよるでしょうが、2BR程度のボロ家なら恐らく転売性も低い。
ボロければメンテ費用も馬鹿にならない。
一般には今底で買い時と言われますけど、それってあくまで一般の話で、
個々の状況によってもちろん当てはまらない場合もあるわけです。
トピ文に書かれている内容だと、買って正解な条件が見当たりません。
買うと借りるのどちらが賢いか？はよくPF記事とかで取り上げられますが、
ご自分の希望が現実的な話なのかよく検討してみてください。
あと、図書館に行けば First time home buyer guide 的な本がたくさんあります。
ユーザーID：7156556157
在米
2010年12月22日 13:14
先ずは、不動産税ですが、カウンティーの役所に行けば、全ての家の評価額と税金が分かります。職員に訊けば、評価額の何パーセントが税金かも教えて貰えます。
ローンですが、男性側がクレジット評価が悪ければ、貴女一人の名前で登記とローンを組む可能性があります。従って、旦那側の収入がローン審査の対象にならない可能性もあります。
毎月幾ら払えるかは、二人とも貯金ゼロという事ですので、現在払っている家賃以下になりますね。安い家を購入したいという事ですので、手直しの分にお金が掛かりますし、定期的な修繕にお金を積み立てる必要があります。従って、今までの状況で貯金ゼロなら、それ以下の返済額でないと、家を直す費用が無くなります。保険については、ローンに付いて来ますので、問題ないでしょう。
トピを見る限りでは、お二人とも家の購入や金銭な事に対して知識が深くないようですので、今は止めた方が良いと思います。その地域を出るまでに、旦那さんのクレジットスコアを回復させる事と、貯金をする事を目標にした方が良いと思います。頭金が家の金額の二割が安全な目標です。頑張って下さいね。

description.hltext_display: Airports under fire amid Europe's travel torment
description.content:
Several Qantas flights have been delayed by snow at Heathrow. [Reuters]
Brendan Trembath and staff
The European Commission has called a meeting with airport officials to look at new ways of dealing with the extreme weather.
The snow in Europe is still causing chaos for travellers, including many Australians trying to get home for Christmas.
Two of the world's busiest airports - Heathrow and Frankfurt - have been among the worst affected.
Heathrow has had five days of chaos, with two-thirds of flights cancelled and many travellers forced to sleep on terminal floors.
Two planeloads of Qantas passengers face a disrupted Christmas after their flights to and from Heathrow were cancelled.
The airline says some flights will go ahead as normal but more delays or cancellations could occur.
The European Commission is so concerned about the travel chaos that it has called airport officials to a meeting in coming days.
"Airports simply must get serious about planning for these kind of severe weather conditions," said Helen Kearns, a spokeswoman for the EU transport commissioner.
"We have seen, in recent years, that snow in Western Europe is not such an exceptional circumstance."
It has been the worst week for airports and airlines since April, when most flights in Europe were cancelled as an ash cloud from a volcano in Iceland drifted across the continent.
When the delays at Heathrow run into days, it is enough to test anyone's patience.
"[It's] absolutely terrible. There's been no management whatsoever in any shape or form," one passenger said.
But other travellers have been more fortunate, with one man making it through the turmoil in the terminal and on to a flight to Sydney.
"I've come from London. I've waited about two days. I was meant to catch a flight at 12:00pm on Saturday and I have to say, Heathrow was pretty chaotic. Fist fights and chaos and tears," he said.
Therese Rein, the wife of Foreign Minister Kevin Rudd, is also held up in London and is at risk of missing Christmas at home.
Mr Rudd says his wife had been expected home on Thursday and she is trying to find an alternate way home.
But the former prime minister says her presents will still be under the tree when she returns.
But British prime minister David Cameron says BAA, which runs Heathrow, has no excuse.
"I'm frustrated on behalf of all those affected that it's taking so long for the situation to improve," he said.
BAA says both runways are now open but that the airport is operating a reduced flight schedule while aircraft and crews move back into position.
London's second airport Gatwick has also had delayed flights and cancellations because of the snow.
In Germany fresh snowfall lead to the closure of Frankfurt airport for several hours.

description.hltext_display: Window Treatments that Suit every décor
description.content: Window treatments are very important part of a house décor. They provide elegancy and improve the look of a room. They are more functional than an ordinary window curtain. These treatments provide protection from harmful U.V. rays and unwanted light to enter into house. With them, you prevent your furniture from discoloration due to the continuous exposure to Sunlight and help you to shield the unwanted light and heat without blocking the required natural energy. Wood blinds are such window treatments which are very popular with many interior experts and homemakers due to their cost effectiveness and various designs available in market. These timber blinds are available in two types- made up from faux (fake) and real wood. Going by the appearance and looks, it is very difficult to tell the difference between the two. If you go to market, you will find that faux blinds are comparatively cheaper to the original blinds. As these are made up from the fabric that is hardened and made to look like wood, it needs no big maintenance from your side. Window draperies stand apart in the class and elegancy. They are durable and you can decorate every single window pane of your house and redefine the interior decoration of your house. Window treatments are durable and can stand the extreme weather easily. Cleaning them is also hassle free. You can clean them with vacuum cleaner or a solution of water and vinegar will also do. They safeguard your house against light, outer noise and provide you complete privacy. Though, they do appear bulky in appearance yet are light in weight. You can also consider customizing the treatments for the perfect fit. Window hardware like wood blinds is available in many colors and can easily match any décor. Though, it is recommended that you take color of blinds in contrast to the furniture. This will emerge the appearance of room more artistically and beautifully. Whether the entire decorum of the room is in vintage style or contemporary, these have the capability to blend in with any style and budget. You may not be fond of wooden furniture, but no way can you ignore the timber window blinds.
